com.javax0.jdsl.analyzers

Class TestAnalyzer

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.javax0.jdsl.analyzers.TestAnalyzer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Analyzer, Rule

    public class TestAnalyzer
extends Object
implements Rule
    An analyzer that can be used to test that an analyzer would be successful at a certain point.

    The test will result success/failed if the underlying analyzer is successful and fails if that fail. The actual return success/fail is inverted if the constructor argument invert is true. When the returned result is success it contains the original source code and null state and executor.

    To use this analyzer statically import the method test(Analyzer) and/or not(Analyzer) and use them in the GrammarDefinition implementation.

    The method testNot(Analyzer) is a complimentary method and can be used instead of not(Analyzer) when the word "testNot" is better for the readability.

    Author:
    Peter Verhas
